questions.text: How did Diane get the last beer to the back?
questions.correct: She balanced it on her head.
options: She carried it on a tray.
questions.explanation:
She balanced it on her head.

	Carla teased Diane when Diane said she'd come back for the drink. Not wanting to look inferior to Carla, Diane balanced it on her head.

Lissa Levin.

	Lissa Levin only wrote for this episode of "Cheers". She also wrote for many other shows including "Mr. Belvedere" and "Who's the Boss?".

questions.text: Who was arguing in this episode?
questions.explanation:
Sam and Diane.

	Diane said they were not fighting, only discussing a difference of opinion. Sam said they were fighting about how Diane didn't trust him.

questions.text: Whom did Norm bring to the bar?
questions.explanation:
Emily Phillips.

	Emily was played by Anne Schedeen. She was born Luanne Ruth Schedeen January 8, 1949. She is best known for playing Kate Tanner on "Alf".

questions.text: Did Norm say he came to Cheers often?
questions.explanation:
No.

	Norm asked her what often was and she said "2-3 times a week". Norm replied, "Then no I don't come here often."

questions.text: What did Norm's friends think about the woman Norm brought to the bar?
options: the woman was really a man
the woman was not interested in Norm
the woman was an undercover agent
questions.explanation:
the woman was after Norm.

	They tried to convince Norm to have an affair. Norm didn't want to look like a wuss in front of his friends so he left with the woman.

questions.text: What did Carla say is the only difference between "Dynasty" and the real world?
questions.explanation:
"They have better hair."

	"Dynasty" was a soap opera on TV from 1981-1989. It starred John Forsythe and Linda Evans. In essence what Carla was saying was that life is a soap opera.

questions.text: What did Diane ask Norm to do before he cheated on his wife?
options: Play a game of pool against her
questions.explanation:
Call Vera.

	Diane figured that if Norm heard Vera's voice he wouldn't be able to go through with it. Norm talked on the phone in such a way they thought it was the answering machine when in reality it was Vera.

questions.text: What did Cliff say the human man could never have enough of?
questions.explanation:
women.

	Cliff was trying to explain to Diane why it was okay for Norm to cheat on Vera. Diane wasn't hearing it, and thought Norm should remain faithful.

No.

	In the end, Norm couldn't go through with it because as he told Sam, he loved his wife. However, that didn't stop him from cracking jokes about his wife.
